message: Just saw this as well. It indeed looks like we could run a full django stack on GAE.
It was a pretty good filter to avoid clients that insisted on GAE as a platform.

Here's the link: http://googlecode.blogspot.com/2011/10/google-cloud-sql-your-database-in-cloud.html

Does this mean you can now run full Django on App Engine?

The worst affect of GAE has been over the past year or so have been on the consulting industry. All clients blindly wanted their django apps to run on appengine :-|  I guess google's buzzwords got to most of them.

Yup looks like it. But do beware of the pricing, quite a few people felt betrayed when the pricing was increased by a *lot*. I've never considered appengine for serious apps, but now it's definitely worth a look again.
thanks but no thanks. i'm more of a Gondor.io fan
Do you know anybody who is working on GAESQL - Django db module?
I don't know!! It's very interesting!! :)
I don't know!! It's very interesting!! :)

Can I use Django with Google Cloud SQL?
No, currently Google Cloud SQL is not compatible with Django.
http://code.google.com/apis/sql/faq.html#django
No, it  seems that we'll need a custom backend to use Django with Google Cloud SQL. They use a custom Python library to allow developers to connect to the DB.
So, has anyone implemented a custom backend?
